revised_title: Vascular Circulation and Capillary Systems in the Crab Carcinus Brain and Optic Lobe
tldr: The study investigates the vascular circulation and capillary systems in the brain and optic lobe of the crab Carcinus. It demonstrates the extensive blood supply to the synaptic areas in the optic lobe, which is correlated with previous findings that integrated visual reflexes fail shortly after interrupting the blood supply. The research reveals the organization of the blood capillary system within the central nervous system and its relationship with synaptic areas in the structured neuropile of the optic lobes.
